requirements: Non-competes ENFORCEABLE under statutory guidelines

West Virginia Uniform Trade Secrets Act and common law allow reasonable non-competes. Must protect legitimate business interest (trade secrets, customer relationships, specialized training). Reasonableness based on time, geography, and scope. Typically 1-2 years reasonable.
Best practice: Limit to 1-2 years, reasonable geographic scope, protect legitimate interests
Action required: Ensure reasonableness in time, geography, and scope
laws.notes: West Virginia Uniform Trade Secrets Act and common law allow reasonable non-competes. Must protect legitimate business interest (trade secrets, customer relationships, specialized training). Reasonableness based on time, geography, and scope. Typically 1-2 years reasonable.

requirements: West Virginia minimum wage: $8.75/hour (2016-present)
West Virginia state minimum wage is $8.75/hour, higher than federal minimum. Applies to employers with 6 or more employees.
Action required: Ensure compliance with state minimum wage

laws.summary: Final wages due next regular payday or within 72 hours
requirements: Final wages due next regular payday or within 72 hours
Discharged employees: within 72 hours. Resigned employees: next regular payday.
Action required: Ensure timely final payment capability
Pay within 72 hours if terminated, next payday if quit
laws.notes: Discharged employees: within 72 hours. Resigned employees: next regular payday.

laws.summary: West Virginia is a RIGHT TO WORK state (2016)
requirements: West Virginia is a RIGHT TO WORK state (2016)
Union membership and dues payment cannot be required as condition of employment
Action required: Cannot require union membership

laws.summary: Meal breaks REQUIRED for 6+ hour shifts
requirements: Meal breaks REQUIRED for 6+ hour shifts
Employees working 6+ consecutive hours must receive at least 20-minute meal break. Break period is unpaid if employee is completely relieved of duties.
Action required: Ensure meal break policy complies with state law
Provide 20-minute meal break for 6+ hour shifts
laws.notes: Employees working 6+ consecutive hours must receive at least 20-minute meal break. Break period is unpaid if employee is completely relieved of duties.

laws.summary: Must pay employees at least semi-monthly
requirements: Must pay employees at least semi-monthly
Regular employees must be paid at least twice per month (semi-monthly). Manual laborers and certain workers must be paid weekly or bi-weekly.
Action required: Establish semi-monthly or more frequent pay schedule
Pay at least semi-monthly (twice per month)
laws.notes: Regular employees must be paid at least twice per month (semi-monthly). Manual laborers and certain workers must be paid weekly or bi-weekly.
